Name: Tooltip
Description: A popup that displays information related to an element when the element receives keyboard focus or the mouse hovers over it.

SubComponentData.Name: Provider
SubComponentData.Description: Wraps your app to provide global functionality to your tooltips.

PropData.Name: delayDuration
PropData.Description: The duration from when the mouse enters a tooltip trigger until the tooltip opens.

PropData.Name: skipDelayDuration
PropData.Description: How much time a user has to enter another trigger without incurring a delay again.

PropData.Name: disableHoverableContent
PropData.Description: Prevents Tooltip.Content from remaining open when hovering. Disabling this has accessibility consequences.

SubComponentData.Name: Root
SubComponentData.Description: Contains all the parts of a tooltip.

PropData.Name: defaultOpen
PropData.Description: The open state of the tooltip when it is initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control its open state.

PropData.Name: open
PropData.Description: The controlled open state of the tooltip. Must be used in conjunction with onOpenChange.

PropData.Name: onOpenChange
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the tooltip changes.

PropData.Name: delayDuration
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the tooltip changes.

PropData.Name: disableHoverableContent
PropData.Description: Prevents Tooltip.Content from remaining open when hovering. Disabling this has accessibility consequences. Inherits from Tooltip.Provider.

SubComponentData.Name: Trigger
SubComponentData.Description: The button that toggles the tooltip. By default, the Tooltip.Content will position itself against the trigger.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

SubComponentData.Name: Portal
SubComponentData.Description: When used, portals the content part into the body.

PropData.Name: forceMount
PropData.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries. If used on this part, it will be inherited by Tooltip.Content.

PropData.Name: container
PropData.Description: Specify a container element to portal the content into.

SubComponentData.Name: Content
SubComponentData.Description: The component that pops out when the tooltip is open.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: aria-label
PropData.Description: By default, screenreaders will announce the content inside the component. If this is not descriptive enough, or you have content that cannot be announced, use aria-label as a more descriptive label.

PropData.Name: onEscapeKeyDown
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the escape key is down. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

PropData.Name: onPointerDownOutside
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the escape key is down. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

PropData.Name: forceMount
PropData.Description: Event handler called when a pointer event occurs outside the bounds of the component. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

PropData.Name: sideOffset
PropData.Description: The preferred side of the trigger to render against when open. Will be reversed when collisions occur and avoidCollisions is enabled.

PropData.Name: alignOffset
PropData.Description: The preferred alignment against the trigger. May change when collisions occur.

PropData.Name: avoidCollisions
PropData.Description: When true, overrides the side andalign preferences to prevent collisions with boundary edges.

PropData.Name: collisionBoundary
PropData.Description: The element used as the collision boundary. By default this is the viewport, though you can provide additional element(s) to be included in this check.

PropData.Name: collisionPadding
PropData.Description: The distance in pixels from the boundary edges where collision detection should occur. Accepts a number (same for all sides), or a partial padding object, for example: { top: 20, left: 20 }.

PropData.Name: arrowPadding
PropData.Description: The padding between the arrow and the edges of the content. If your content has border-radius, this will prevent it from overflowing the corners.

PropData.Name: hideWhenDetached
PropData.Description: The sticky behavior on the align axis. "partial" will keep the content in the boundary as long as the trigger is at least partially in the boundary whilst "always" will keep the content in the boundary regardless.

EnumData.Name: side
EnumData.Description: The preferred side of the trigger to render against when open. Will be reversed when collisions occur and avoidCollisions is enabled.

EnumData.Name: align
EnumData.Description: The preferred alignment against the trigger. May change when collisions occur.

EnumData.Name: sticky
EnumData.Description: The sticky behavior on the align axis. "partial" will keep the content in the boundary as long as the trigger is at least partially in the boundary whilst "always" will keep the content in the boundary regardless.

SubComponentData.Name: Arrow
SubComponentData.Description: An optional arrow element to render alongside the tooltip. This can be used to help visually link the trigger with the Tooltip.Content. Must be rendered inside Tooltip.Content.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: width
PropData.Description: The width of the arrow in pixels.

PropData.Name: height
PropData.Description: The height of the arrow in pixels.
